title_sort: walt whitman to the editor of the new york herald, 26–29 (?) december 1864
title: Walt Whitman to the Editor of the New York Herald, 26–29 (?) December 1864

person.name: Editor of the New York Herald

recipient.name: Editor of the New York Herald

people: Editor of the New York Herald
text: Private note to Editor.Sir I respectfully ask you to print this communication written to start a public demand for the general exchange of prisoners of war. As the question now stands, the fault is altogether with our government. I hope you will feel to say a word editorialy[editorially] about it, perhaps call attention in that way to the communication.I solicit that you will find room for it to-morrow morn'g as I have sent this afternoon similar communications to one or two other papers, (though this one is different in form & made specialy[specially] for the Herald. Walt Whitman to the Editor of the New York Herald, 26–29 (?) December 1864
